moves.1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 d6: Black chooses the Philidor Defense, less popular for sure.
moves.3. d4 f5: Even more less popular is this gambit.
moves.4. dxe5 fxe4 5. Ng5: White moves the Knight to attack the pawn or...
moves.5... h6: ...If black does something like this, then white can win significant material or achieve a quick mate (which happens here).
moves.6. Qh5+ Kd7: Only move, the other legal move gave white mate.
moves.7. e6+ Kc6: Again only move to avoid mate.
moves.8. Nf7: Black must choose to lose its queen or suffer mate.

opening: Philidor (C41), Philidor counter-gambit, del Rio attack
